variants.Description in input context: Pathogenic mutations in LRRK2 (e.g., G2019S) associated with increased kinase activity

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Protein Expression and Inclusion Body Analysis

Material used.Material Source: Neuronal cell lines and human midbrain neurons
Material used.Material Name: Neuronal cell lines (e.g., SH-SY5Y) and primary human midbrain neurons
Material used.Description: Neurons and neuronal cell lines were used to study the effects of mutant dardarin (LRRK2) expression.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Qualitative (inclusion body formation) and Quantitative (cell death assays)

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Gain-of-function (increased kinase activity) in pathogenic mutants
Readout description.Result Description: Expression of pathogenic LRRK2 mutants led to increased inclusion body formation and neuronal cell death.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 expression served as a positive control for normal kinase activity.

Basic negative control.Description: Kinase-dead LRRK2 (Fkinase-dead) mutant served as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Absence of inclusion bodies and <10% cell death

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of inclusion bodies and >30% cell death
